description: Your all-in-one suite of SEO essentials.
content: B By: britishblue September 10, 2007 Changes to the Algorithm Search Engines I think there has been a change in the Google algorthym which is upgrading older pages and downgrading newer pages. I am basing this statement on the 14 websites I run. These websites are of different age and sit on different servers, registered under different name.We have a strategy than when have new content for it to be totally unique. We research the topic and include totally orig... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin August 29, 2007 Matt Cutts on Nofollow, Links-Per-Page and the Value of Directories Search Engines Matt Cutts and I have a beautiful relationship - I bother him enough and he gives me answers to questions that are bothering webmasters. It's a cross between symbiotic and vampirical (vampiristic?). Thankfully, Matt has once again let me suck away some of his precious time to address some big issues. After this, I think I'll let him have a rest and probably go after poor Tim. I've poste... Read this post By: Dr. Peter J. Meyers August 29, 2007 Life After Supplemental Search Engines A few months back, I posted the saga of how I helped a client finally escape from Google Supplemental. Given the positive response to that article and some great follow-up questions, I closely tracked some relevant Google data over the four months since and thought I'd share some of what I learned. ... Read this post By: rmccarley August 27, 2007 The best policy for Googleâ€™s anti-link buying and selling policy Search Engines Google has demanded webmasters hide paid links through the use of code manipulation like 302 redirects, JavaScript, robots.txt and nofollows. This goes against their Webmaster Guidelines which state: Make ... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin August 26, 2007 Purple Yahoo! and Search Engine UI Testing Search Engines Mystery Guest and I were running some queries on Yahoo! earlier this afternoon, when we received my personal favorite search results UI test pages, the beloved Purple Yahoo! Purple Yahoo! is a rare beast, from what I've seen. This is only the second time I can remember being served the results, though I know others have seen it before ... Read this post By: Jane Copland August 23, 2007 Dear Google Search Engines As a midyear Christmas present, I'd like to ask Google for a few things that would make my life a bit easier. Just to clarify, Google, I love you very much and I think you're superb, but everyone can do better. These are my requests: Read this post D By: DavidIFR August 13, 2007 Overcoming a Google Penalty: A Small Business Case Study Search Engines My business' website recently fell victim to some of Google's penalty measures. Thankfully I was able to overcome them and just wanted to share my experiences. In the course of searching for answers and a remedy to the problem, I read some of the articles from SEOMOZ (particularly this one by randfish) http://www.seomoz.org/blog/how-to-handle-a-google-penalty-and-an-example-... Read this post By: Peter Newsome July 23, 2007 Bring back supplemental results... so we did. Search Engines Over the past couple of weeks most SEO blogs have made mention of Google removing their supplemental results search feature.Rand asked nicely in his post: Google - Please Bring Back the Supplemental Results Query; It's Incredibly Valuable but from some of Matt Cutt... Read this post By: Hamlet Batista July 19, 2007 7 Reasons Why Search Engines Don't Return Relevant Results 100% of the Time Search Engines While search engine representatives and light hatters (the whitest of the white hatters) say that having great, link-worthy content and links is enough to get high rankings, there are many sites with these traits that do not get listed for the words that matter (the ones that send serious traffic). If it were so easy and every page that deserved a high ranking had it, there would be n... Read this post P By: Patrick Sexton July 16, 2007 How to Turn Your Feed Into a Google Gadget Search Engines Does everyone have a Google gadget except you? Here is what you do.1) Go to the Google gadget directory 2) Click the little link that says "Add by URL"3) Enter your feed URL and click "Add"You are finished, your feed is now a Google gadget.... Read this post G By: gleddy July 16, 2007 Cloaking vs Image Replacement: Hiding Text is Not a Bad Thing Search Engines Image replacement can be a contentious issue when it comes to optimizing your websites for a search engine, but is widely supported by leading-edge web standards developers attempting to create more visually appealing websites for their users whilst still retaining semantic, accessible code. Read this post By: Rand Fishkin July 15, 2007 Dan Crow of Google on Crawling, Indexing & Ranking Search Engines The SEMNE organization landed an incredible opportunity last week with a guest lecture from Dan Crow. I've seen Dan speak once before several years ago and was shocked by his overly secretive conduct. Thankfully, Google, and apparently, Dan, have changed a lot since then. He had some remarkable... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin July 6, 2007 Google - Please Bring Back the Supplemental Results Query; It's Incredibly Valuable Search Engines Tonight, Matt McGee noticed that the supplemental results query at Google, using the format: site:yoursite.com *** -asdf is no longer functioning. I'm fairly certain that the source of this issue can be traced back to a Mr. Matt Cutts, who was permitted to sit in at the "Give It Up" session at SMX where one of the first broadly public mentions of th... Read this post T By: Tom Critchlow June 28, 2007 Do a search for 'wikipedia' and see what happens. Surprised?! I was... Search Engines Wierdness Number 1 - Google only displays 36 results for a 'wikipedia' searchOk, so I was trawling the referring keywords to our blog the other day and noticed that we'd had 3 clicks for the keyphrase 'wikipedia' following this blog post on why wikipedia is ...
